e4: I recommend changing to the new policy because reporting unbiased earnings aligns with ethical standards, enhancing transparency and credibility with investors. Although transitioning may cause short-term misunderstandings, in the long run, it helps in establishing trust, reducing legal risks associated with biased reporting, and ensuring fair investor treatment across all types of investors.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and fairness, ensuring all investors have truthful and accessible information. It should avoid any biases or manipulations that could mislead, regardless of general awareness. The policy must comply with laws and regulations, minimizing legal liabilities. Communication strategies need clarity to help investors, especially less sophisticated ones, understand changes and impacts. Consistent application enhances credibility and trust. Additionally, ethical policies should foster equal opportunities for investment decisions, deterring advantages of more knowledgeable investors over casual or retail investors. In the broader context, ethics extends to social responsibilities and sustainable corporate governance.
e6: I would ask management how they plan to communicate the policy change to ensure investor understanding, specifically targeting retail investors less attuned to policy shifts. I would also inquire about risk assessment on potential market reactions and see how management anticipates and reduces short-term misconceptions in EPS reporting.
